constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 212 (Wednesday, December 8, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. TRAHAN:
H.R. 6200.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the United States
Constitution: ``The Congress shall have Power . . . To make
all Laws which shall be necessary and proper for carrying
into Execution the foregoing Powers, and all other Powers
vested by this Constitution in the Government of the United
States, or in any Department or Officer thereof.''
[Page H7556]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

title: Freedom’s Way National Heritage Area Act of 2021
